intro: Chaenorhinum origanifolium var. lapeyrouseanum, commonly known as the Lapeyrouse's heartleaf toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as sagebrush steppe. This variety is closely related to other members of the Plantaginaceae family, sharing similar growth habits and floral structures.
